About me

Full-stack developer

My bio

I'm a pragmatic, solution-oriented and compassionate software developer with several years of industry experience under my belt. I also have a solid grasp of machine learning concepts from my Master's level studies in Computational Engineering. My other passions include playing the guitar, competitive online gaming, disc golf and tinkering with small "maker" projects.

Visma Solutions, Software Developer, 5/2017- (ongoing)

I am currently developing Netvisor as a full-stack developer, converting customer needs into practical solutions that are usable, testable and maintainable. I have implemented functional and modern user interfaces, developed software integrations, refactored and modernized legacy solutions, and much more.

LUT School of Engineering Science, research assistant, 6-8/2016 (2 mo)

I designed and implemented a prototype web application for visualizing certain data according to the faculty's needs from the ground up. I made technical decisions, taught myself to use the technology stack chosen, and kept a tight feedback loop with the end customer during development. Used a flexible architecture to account for rapid changes in requirements.

LUT Faculty of Industrial Management, trainee, 6/2013 (1 mo)

I tested and evaluated learning material for the Unity game engine (Beginning 3D Game Development with Unity). Developed an example game according to the material over the summer, documenting areas where I had trouble and errors in the book. Evaluated suitability for freshmen from a high schooler's perspective.
